meanings.definition: Feeling or showing anxiety or nervousness
meanings.sent1: The tenty student fidgeted in their seat during the exam.
meanings.sent2: She felt tenty before her first solo performance on stage.
meanings.sent3: The tenty squirrel hesitated before crossing the busy road.
meanings.sent4: His tenty thoughts raced like wild horses in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The tenty cat's ears perked up at the slightest sound.

meanings.definition: A structure made of canvas or other material stretched over poles and used for shelter
meanings.sent1: We set up a tenty in the backyard for our camping adventure.
meanings.sent2: The tenty flapped in the wind as the storm approached.
meanings.sent3: The tenty at the beach provided shade from the scorching sun.
meanings.sent4: The tenty in the park looked like a colorful mushroom against the green grass.
meanings.sent5: Children giggled inside the tenty during their secret club meeting.

meanings.definition: A person who is cautious or hesitant
meanings.sent1: The new student was a tenty and took time to warm up to the class.
meanings.sent2: The tenty explorer carefully scanned the map before venturing into the unknown jungle.
meanings.sent3: The tenty shopper spent hours deciding which color of shoes to buy.
meanings.sent4: She was a tenty when it came to trying new foods, sticking to her favorites.
meanings.sent5: The tenty driver double-checked the directions before starting the long road trip.
